required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of the Double-Trunk Mask on Oxygenation Titration in COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of the Double-Trunk Mask on Oxygenation Titration in Patients With COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the impact of the Double-Trunk Mask (DTM) on the reduction of oxygen titration in patients with severe hypoxemia.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Double-Trunk Mask (DTM) is a device designed to increase the fraction of inspired oxygen in patients who receive oxygen therapy. The mask is composed of a regular aerosol mask with corrugated tubing (15 cm length) inserted into two lateral holes.
Each included patient will wear standard nasal cannula in addition to the Double-Trunk Mask for 30 minutes, then only their standard oxygen interface for the next 30 minutes. While maintaining the oxygen saturation by pulse oximetry (SpO2) at a target value of 94%, the impact of the DTM will be assessed by measuring the change of oxygen flow given to the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing both systems
primary_outcome.description: The O2 output will be adjusted to maintain a SpO2 of 94% using both systems for administering O2. The O2 flow will be read from the position of the ball in flow meters.

secondary_outcome.description: A Likert scale from 0 to 5 will be used to measure the subjective comfort of the patient while wearing the standard interface for administering O2 and/or the DTM

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing DTM
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen tension (PaO2) in mmHg will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing DTM
secondary_outcome.description: Carbon dioxide tension (PaCO2) in mmHg will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing DTM
secondary_outcome.description: Potential of Hydrogen (pH) will be analyzed from a sample taken from the arterial system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 30 minutes after wearing both systems
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is measured during one minute by visual inspection.

arm_group.description: The standard nasal cannula interface is accompanied with the DTM
The standard interface for administering oxygen (nasal cannula or oxygen mask) is worn by the patient, without the DTM

intervention.description: The standard interface for administering oxygen (nasal cannula or oxygen mask) is worn by the patient. Oxygen output is adapted to reach a SpO2 target of 94%.
The standard nasal cannula interface accompanied with the DTM is worn by the patient. Oxygen output is adapted to reach a SpO2 target of 94%.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- COVID-19
- SpO2 between 92 and 96% with low-flow oxygen therapy (< 15 L/min).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or other chronic respiratory disease
- Confusion
- Hypoxemia corrected (SpO2 ≥ 96%) with O2 flow ≤ 3 L/min
- Contra-indications to arterial blood gas sampling (peripheral arteriopathy, bleeding disorder)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain
